channel.title: Asides on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Asides on Deuts Log

item.title: Python Manager
item.description:
Python Manager

A web-based tool for managing multiple Python scripts with real-time monitoring, logging, and control. Perfect for managing microservices, data pipelines, background jobs, or any collection of Python scripts.
item.content:encoded:
Python Manager

A web-based tool for managing multiple Python scripts with real-time monitoring, logging, and control. Perfect for managing microservices, data pipelines, background jobs, or any collection of Python scripts.

item.title: QR Ding
item.description:
QR Ding

QRding is a simple self-hosted QR code generator. It includes templates for creating QR codes for sharing WiFi credentials, contact cards and text or links. In the long-term the goal is to build an automation system around QR codes which allows you to trigger custom actions, track actions or habits and send notifications when a scan event is not triggered.
item.content:encoded:
QR Ding

QRding is a simple self-hosted QR code generator. It includes templates for creating QR codes for sharing WiFi credentials, contact cards and text or links. In the long-term the goal is to build an automation system around QR codes which allows you to trigger custom actions, track actions or habits and send notifications when a scan event is not triggered.

item.title: QRDing: Self-hosted QR code generator
item.description:
QRDing: Self-hosted QR code generator

QRding is a simple self-hosted QR code generator. It includes templates for creating QR codes for sharing WiFi credentials, contact cards and text or links. In the long-term the goal is to build an automation system around QR codes which allows you to trigger custom actions, track actions or habits and send notifications when a scan event is not triggered.
Wish it had a robust API that I can play around with.
item.content:encoded:
QRDing: Self-hosted QR code generator

QRding is a simple self-hosted QR code generator. It includes templates for creating QR codes for sharing WiFi credentials, contact cards and text or links. In the long-term the goal is to build an automation system around QR codes which allows you to trigger custom actions, track actions or habits and send notifications when a scan event is not triggered.
Wish it had a robust API that I can play around with.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JXNQBQNTCE2TMVP9N4AZR386
item.description:
He probably meant OTP over SMS. There are also authenticator apps, you know, that are far safer than over SMS.

BSP orders banks to go beyond OTPs business.inquirer.net/∞

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JXANQEFEC2V9CST2J3CHB610
item.description: Tried out Windows 10 LTSC. One bump: no built-in Windows Terminal, and I’m already considering switching back to Windows 11 Pro. Can’t even do Ctrl + Shift + V in Command Prompt to paste from the clipboard!
item.content:encoded: Tried out Windows 10 LTSC. One bump: no built-in Windows Terminal, and I’m already considering switching back to Windows 11 Pro. Can’t even do Ctrl + Shift + V in Command Prompt to paste from the clipboard!

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JXAGN5RQ9PFC3TE10DY7T14H
item.description: While installing Windows 10 LTSC, was going through the list of my must-have apps. One of those is WordWeb for a time now. Now I’m wondering if there’s still have a need for that. ChatGPT can help me better with word definitions, synonyms and antonyms.
item.content:encoded: While installing Windows 10 LTSC, was going through the list of my must-have apps. One of those is WordWeb for a time now. Now I’m wondering if there’s still have a need for that. ChatGPT can help me better with word definitions, synonyms and antonyms.
